Articles.Content:
2 nice easy to fly rockets for training your orbital skills.

Both will reliably get 1 guy into LKO or a bit higher (and with better piloting skills than mine further still probably.

Only stock parts used, tested with 0.20

The Jebjob 1a. Probably doesn't need the battery, but was planning to add some stuff in a science bay for another flight.

http://www.hornet.demon.nl/KSP/Jebjob%201a.craft

The Needle 1 Heavy. Take care on 2nd stage separation, she tends to start tumbling for some reason. Added RCS to control that. (yes, the TT38s work in this one, built another rocket using them though where they refused to cooperate, but that one used them to stage liquid boosters).

http://www.hornet.demon.nl/KSP/Needle%201%20Heavy.craft

general purpose launchers, nice for people to learn to fly.

Does a rocket need a purpose, except to be loud and sometimes go boom

just wondering how long have you been playing KSP

by the way nice rockets:D
You can make a much simpler rocket with less fuel on board to get a kerbal up in LKO.
You can do a lot of things DaRocket, but instead of being negative about someone who is fairly new, why not give a suggestion so he can improve if you are so good.
For you should add fuel lines that pump from the liquid boosters and to the main rocket. That'll make sure that the main rocket has full tanks when you drop the boosters.
